messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] engraved invite
messages.msgSnippet: We have a little house and one bathroom, so you d probably go nuts. But we d love the company and there s always a bed or two available since they re usually
messages.messageBody:
We have a little house and one bathroom, so you'd probably go nuts. But we'd love the company and there's always a bed or two available since they're usually in with me. Then there's the couch and sleeping bags on the floor...:)




LOL!

Oh we've done that before!! I was supposed to visit with a friend in Phili. But her whole family fell ill while we were in the city. We were close enough to home that we could have gone home but somehow, I don't even remember how, we ended up staying with another family that we had met "online". We even had an offer from yet *another* family that we knew online. (I think we had all agreed to meet at the Franklin Institute because that is where we met).

We slept on her living room floor. I have to confess, it was quite the adventure, staying at a stranger's house, sleeping on their floor!!!

Someday I'll have to write a book about untraveling!!

Kristen
----- Original Message -----
From: starsuncloud@...
To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Friday, June 13, 2003 10:45 PM
Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] engraved invite



>Where do you live??? I"m thinking as soon as I get the bills paid
through
>July I'm going to start planning some trips for next year. Maybe I'll
>have to call upon all you unschooler hostesses that offered your homes for
>traveling unschoolers.


Put us on your list. As long as you don't plan to stay more than a couple nights!!:) Actually, I wouldn't mind, but it's rather crowded. We have a little house and one bathroom, so you'd probably go nuts. But we'd love the company and there's always a bed or two available since they're usually in with me. Then there's the couch and sleeping bags on the floor...:)

Ren

Yahoo! Groups Sponsor
